nodes.label: Dictionary
nodes.desc: This project aims to facilitate a common understanding of frequently used terms across the construction industry, connect these terms to vetted learning material, and act as a reference to current and future online tools

nodes.label: Project Admin
nodes.desc: Managing project scope, resources and timeline. Development of protocols; instigating and managing relationships with 3rd parties; and continuous alignment with other BIMe Initiative projects.

nodes.label: Canonical English
nodes.desc: Development and updating of Dictionary Items covering all common international terms within Noteworthy BIM Publications plus those identified within national and international standards in English.

nodes.label: ISO Standards Topic Curation
nodes.desc: inclusion and alignment of ISO terms and definitions witin the dictionary

nodes.label: Extended Descriptions
nodes.desc: Identification and invitation of subject matter experts to contribute texts, charts and videos to extend the summary description of specific terms into short encyclopedic entries. Each Extended Description is a separate Work Package within the Microproject.

nodes.label: LOTE Translations
nodes.desc: Translation and continuous updating of Language Other Than English (LOTE) terms. Each Language Team will have its own Microproject Code - assigned by chronological order (e.g. A4.01 Spanish Language).

nodes.label: Localisations
nodes.desc: Localisation of terms and descriptions based on jurisdictions and geographical locations.

nodes.label: Tool Development
nodes.desc: Development of varied tools as needed by the BIMei Community.

nodes.label: Tool Development - Front End
nodes.desc: Continuous improvement of the online UI/UX. Generation of a Terminology Explorer (interactive map); Custom Terms List; built-in Commenting Engine; and printing, exporting and linking features.

nodes.label: Tool Development - Backend
nodes.desc: Development of an Editorial Dashboard to manage translations/updates and communication amongst Editors.Improvement of versioning and version control (allowing external links to a specific version). Database optimisation. Improvement and documentation of the API.

nodes.label: Outreach Programme
nodes.desc: Establishing collaboration agreements and promoting the use of the BIM Dictionary by varied organisations.

nodes.label: Outreach to Educational Institutions
nodes.desc: Connecting with universities and other technical institutes to encourage adoption of the BIM Dictionary in educational settings.

nodes.label: Outreach to Industry Associations
nodes.desc: Connecting with membership-based organisations to encourage adoption of the BIM Dictionary in their CPD programmes.

nodes.label: Outreach to Policy Makers
nodes.desc: Connecting with authorities to develop country-specific addendums to materials within the BIM Dictionary.

nodes.label: Knowledge Sharing
nodes.desc: This project aims to facilitate knowledge-sharing between BIMe Members/Volunteers and the wider community.

nodes.label: Project Admin
nodes.desc: Project Management activities

nodes.label: Knowledge Organisation
nodes.desc: Ontologies, Taxonomies and Topics (applicable across BIMei)

nodes.label: Websites & Webtools
nodes.desc: Management of the BIMexcellence.org website

nodes.label: Community Forums
nodes.desc: Management of forums.bimexcellence.org (stopped, to be replaced)

nodes.label: Social Media
nodes.desc: Management of social media accounts

nodes.label: Seminars
nodes.desc: Preparation and delivery of public events including conferences, online seminars, and similar activities.

nodes.label: Rich Media
nodes.desc: Development of videos, podcasts and interactive content covering the BIMe Initiative as a whole

nodes.label: Translations & Localisations
nodes.desc: Translation and localisation of resources and webpages; each is a Workpackage

nodes.label: Publications
nodes.desc: Publications of varied types (peer-reviewed papers, printable books, and newsletters)

nodes.label: Competence & Learning
nodes.desc: This project focuses on assessing and improving the competency of current and future practitioners across the built environment.

nodes.label: Project Admin
nodes.desc: Project Management activities.

nodes.label: Conceptual Components
nodes.desc: Delivery of conceptual components leading to the development of practical template and online modules.

nodes.label: Competence Inventories
nodes.desc: Collating and maintaining an inventory of Competence Items

nodes.label: Performance Improvement
nodes.desc: This project aims to assist Design, Construction, and Operation (DCO) organisations in assessing and developing their Digital Capability/Maturity.

nodes.label: Project Admin
nodes.desc: Project Management activities.

nodes.label: Conceptual Components
nodes.desc: Delivery of conceptual components leading to the development of practical template and online modules.

nodes.label: Performance Improvement Templates
nodes.desc: The development and continuous update of the performance improvement templates and matrices.

nodes.label: Maturity Matrix GL1
nodes.desc: The development and continuous update of the BIM Maturity Matrix at Granularity Level 1 - currently available as 301in BIM Maturity Matrix.

nodes.label: Maturity Matrix GL2
nodes.desc: The development and continuous update of the BIM Maturity Matrix at Granularity Level 2.

nodes.label: Macro Adoption
nodes.desc: This project aims to assist policy makers to develop (and assess) the macro BIM diffusion policies, strategies and plans within their respective markets.

nodes.label: Managerial Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the decision-making abilities which drive the selection/adoption of long -term strategies and initiatives. Managerial competencies include leadership, strategic planning, and organizational management.

nodes.label: General Management
nodes.desc: Defining and communicating overall managerial goals from adopting new systems and workflows

nodes.label: Leadership
nodes.desc: Leading and guiding others throughout the process of implementing new systems and workflows

nodes.label: Strategic Planning
nodes.desc: Identifying strategic objectives and developing implementation strategies

nodes.label: Organizational Management
nodes.desc: Identifying the organizational changes necessary for instigating, monitoring, and improving BIM Adoption

nodes.label: Business Development and Client Management
nodes.desc: Maximizing the value achieved by the organization and its clients from BIM tools and workflows

nodes.label: Partnership and Alliancing
nodes.desc: Initiating partnerships and alliances with other organizations based on BIM Deliverables and workflows

nodes.label: Administration Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the day -to-day organizational activities required to meet and maintain strategic objectives. Administration competencies include tendering and procurement, contract management, and human resource management.

nodes.label: Administration, Policies and Procedures
nodes.desc: Developing managerial initiatives into policies and procedures to facilitate the adoption of BIM tools and workflows

nodes.label: Finance, Accounting and Budgeting
nodes.desc: Planning, allocating and monitoring the costs associated with BIM Adoption

nodes.label: Performance Management
nodes.desc: Assessing organizational BIM capability/maturity, Individual Competency and project performance using standardized metrics

nodes.label: Human Resource Management
nodes.desc: Planning, developing, and managing human resources as to align staff competencies to organizational BIM goals

nodes.label: Marketing
nodes.desc: Promoting an organization's BIM Capability to its clients and business partners

nodes.label: Tendering and Procurement
nodes.desc: Developing the necessary specifications and documents to pre-qualify, recommend, or procure BIM products and services

nodes.label: Contract Management
nodes.desc: Administering the contractual documentation underlying Collaborative BIM Projects and workflows

nodes.label: Risk Management
nodes.desc: Managing the risks associated with using BIM tools and collaborative workflows

nodes.label: Quality Management
nodes.desc: Establishing, managing and controlling the quality of models, documentation and other Project Deliverables

nodes.label: Functional Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the non-technical, overall abilities required to initiate, manage and deliver projects. Functional competencies include collaboration, facilitation and project management.

nodes.label: Functional Basics
nodes.desc: Identifying the basic requirements and main deliverables expected from using BIM tools and workflows

nodes.label: Collaboration
nodes.desc: Preparing the documentation necessary to enable Model-based Collaboration between Project Participants

nodes.label: Facilitation
nodes.desc: Facilitating the process of BIM collaboration between Project Participants

nodes.label: Project Management
nodes.desc: Managing projects where BIM Workflows are used, and BIM deliverables are specified

nodes.label: Team and Workflow Management
nodes.desc: Managing teams involved in the delivery of BIM Projects

nodes.label: Operation Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the daily, hands-on individual efforts required to deliver a project or part/aspect of a project. Operational competencies include designing, simulating, and quantifying.

nodes.label: General Modelling
nodes.desc: Using software tools to model project requirements and generate Model-based Deliverables across industries, information systems and knowledge domains

nodes.label: Capturing and Representing
nodes.desc: Using software tools and specialized equipment to capture and represent physical spaces and environments

nodes.label: Planning and Designing
nodes.desc: Using software tools for conceptualization, planning and design

nodes.label: Simulating and Quantifying
nodes.desc: Using software tools to conduct various types of model-based simulations and estimations

nodes.label: Constructing and Fabricating
nodes.desc: Using BIModels for the specific purposes of construction and fabrication

nodes.label: Operating and Maintaining
nodes.desc: Using models to operate, manage and maintain a Facility

nodes.label: Monitoring and Controlling
nodes.desc: Using models to monitor Building Performance or control its spaces, systems and equipment

nodes.label: Linking and Extending
nodes.desc: Linking BIModels and their components to other databases

nodes.label: Custom Modelling
nodes.desc: Using software tools to deliver a custom combination of Model-based Deliverables reflecting a variety of Model Uses

nodes.label: Technical Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the abilities required to generate Project Deliverables across disciplines and specialties. Technical competencies include modelling, drafting and model management.

nodes.label: General IT
nodes.desc: Designing, installing, managing, maintaining, and ensuring the security of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) infrastructure including databases, servers, and networks

nodes.label: Software Systems
nodes.desc: Selecting, deploying, and maintaining software systems in a multi-user environment

nodes.label: Hardware and Equipment
nodes.desc: Specifying, recommending, or procuring computer hardware and equipment

nodes.label: Modelling
nodes.desc: Generating BIModels based on pre-defined Modelling Standards and protocols

nodes.label: Documentation
nodes.desc: Generating drawings and construction documents using standardized details and workflows

nodes.label: Presentation and Animation
nodes.desc: Generating professional-quality renderings or 3D animations using Specialized Software Tools

nodes.label: Model Management
nodes.desc: Managing and maintaining BIModels generated using standardized processes, protocols, and specifications

nodes.label: Document Management
nodes.desc: Using Document Management Systems or similar to store, manage and share files and BIModels

nodes.label: Data Management
nodes.desc: Managing data flows – speed, volume, quality, and security - across project, asset, and information lifecycles

nodes.label: Implementation Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the activities required to introduce BIM concepts, tools and workflows into an organization. Implementation competencies include component development, standardization, and technical training.

nodes.label: Implementation Fundamentals
nodes.desc: Identifying and managing issues associated with BIM implementation

nodes.label: Component Development
nodes.desc: Implementing a structured approach for developing or customizing Model Components using documented Modelling Standards

nodes.label: Library Management
nodes.desc: Developing or managing component libraries as required for the standardized delivery of BIM Projects

nodes.label: Standardization and Templates
nodes.desc: Generating standardized templates, item lists and workflows for initiating, checking or delivering BIM Projects

nodes.label: Technical Training
nodes.desc: Developing a BIM Training Plan or maintaining a Skill Register to track staff training and their acquired skills

nodes.label: System and Process Testing
nodes.desc: Assessing the capability/compatibility of systems and the suitability of workflows and procedures

nodes.label: Guides and Manuals
nodes.desc: Developing guides, manuals or educational material covering Model-based Workflows

nodes.label: Supportive Set
nodes.desc: Summary: the abilities needed to maintain information technology and communication systems. Supportive competencies include data and network support, equipment support and software troubleshooting.

nodes.label: General IT Support
nodes.desc: Troubleshooting software issues and supporting staff in resolving technical problems

nodes.label: Data and Network Support
nodes.desc: Managing and maintaining the storage of data, documents, 2D Drawings and BIModels

nodes.label: Equipment Support
nodes.desc: Developing specifications for BIM Hardware and BIM Hardware Deployment Programmes

nodes.label: Software Support
nodes.desc: Addressing issues related to BIM Software Tools, fulfilling relevant Support Tasks and managing the relationship with software vendors/resellers

nodes.label: Software and Web Development
nodes.desc: Developing extensions for BIM Software Tools, productivity software or web portals to improve BIM Deliverables

nodes.label: Research and Development
nodes.desc: Summary: the abilities required to evaluate existing processes, investigate new solutions and facilitate their adoption - within the organization or by the larger industry. R&D competencies include change management, knowledge engineering and industry engagement .

nodes.label: General Research and Development
nodes.desc: Conducting general or BIM-specific research and development activities

nodes.label: Strategy Development and Planning
nodes.desc: Developing a BIM Implementation Strategy or a BIM Implementation Plan to guide BIM Adoption

nodes.label: Teaching and Coaching
nodes.desc: Developing BIM training material to educate staff and facilitate the BIM Adoption process

nodes.label: Knowledge Management and Engineering
nodes.desc: Developing a Knowledge Management Strategy and capturing/representing the BIM-specific knowledge of staff

nodes.label: Change Management
nodes.desc: Developing a Change Management strategy that accompanies/supports the BIM Implementation process

nodes.label: Research and Analysis
nodes.desc: Participating in and/or publishing academic research focused on BIM innovation or collaboration

nodes.label: Industry Engagement and Knowledge Sharing
nodes.desc: Sharing BIM knowledge and experience with the wider industry through formal/informal workshops, seminars, and presentations

nodes.label: Top-level Projects
nodes.desc: Projects delivering end products

nodes.label: Microprojects
nodes.desc: Projects delivering interim components

nodes.label: Workpackages
nodes.desc: Clusters of activity

nodes.label: Knowledge Foundations
nodes.desc: Conceptual constructs

nodes.desc: embedded in a Dictionary Item

nodes.label: Knowledge Blocks
nodes.desc: Modular units of Structured Information

nodes.label: Dictionary Item
nodes.desc: Code generated within BIMdictionary.com

nodes.label: Competency item
nodes.desc: Competency item in Set A, 4-digits.

nodes.label: Information Use
nodes.desc: Document, Data, & Model Use | Category (1-9) 4-digits

nodes.label: Knowledge Tools
nodes.desc: Software applications, modules or templates

nodes.label: Module
nodes.desc: Modules as sub-parts of Tools

nodes.label: Template
nodes.desc: Encased in a publication

nodes.label: Knowledge Workflows
nodes.desc: Procedures, scripts or routines

nodes.label: Knowledge Views
nodes.desc: Videos, lectures or websites

nodes.label: Publication
nodes.desc: Series 200 | Document 1

nodes.desc: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) to be used

nodes.label: Audio Visual
nodes.desc: Published title to be used

nodes.label: Websites/blogs
nodes.desc: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) to be used

nodes.label: Rich Text
nodes.desc: Code is followed by unique ID e.g. RTEXT1907

nodes.label: Project
nodes.desc: A Top-Level Project (leading to an end product) or a Microproject

nodes.label: Activity
nodes.desc: A defined effort within a Workpackage or a Project

nodes.label: Task
nodes.desc: A subdivision of an Activity it smaller work units

nodes.label: Step
nodes.desc: The chronological order to complete a task (steps are indivisible units)

nodes.label: Model Uses
nodes.desc: Identify and collate the Information Requirements that need to be delivered as – or embedded within – 3D digital models. As a Knowledge Block, Model Uses form part of a larger modular language that connects information requirements with System Units, Defined Roles, and Competency Items

nodes.label: General Model Uses
nodes.desc: Applicable across industries, information systems and knowledge domains.  General MUs include the word ‘modelling’ in their name and are typically measured using granularity metrics (e.g. Le vel of Definition , Level of Development and Granularity Level ) at component/item level.

nodes.id: Macro BIM Adoption- Comparative Market Analysis.pdf
nodes.label: Macro BIM Adoption- Comparative Market Analysis.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper analyzes the macro adoption of BIM across 21 countries using five conceptual models. It validates these models through expert surveys, highlights commonalities and differences in BIM adoption, and introduces tools and templates for developing or calibrating BIM adoption policies. It discusses diffusion dynamics, maturity levels, policy actions, and stakeholder responsibilities across different markets.

nodes.id: The Five Components of BIM Performance Measurement.pdf
nodes.label: The Five Components of BIM Performance Measurement.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper identifies five complementary components specifically developed to enable BIM performance assessment: BIM Capability Stages, BIM Maturity Levels, BIM Competencies, Organisational Scales, and Granularity Levels. It positions them as a systematic method to understand, assess, and improve BIM performance.

nodes.id: Lifecycle information transformation and exchange for delivering and managing digital and physical assets.pdf
nodes.label: Lifecycle information transformation and exchange for delivering and managing digital and physical assets.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper introduces the Lifecycle Information Transformation and Exchange (LITE) framework, a conceptual structure designed to improve asset and project lifecycle information exchange and management. The framework accounts for technological innovations enabling the integration of asset lifecycle information, such as Smart Contracts, Robotics, BIM Data Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence, into Design, Construction, and Operation activities. The framework proposes a modular information management approach with components like information statuses, states, milestones, flows, gates, routes, loops, actions, sets, and tiers.

nodes.label: Macro-BIM Adoption, Conceptual Structures.pdf
nodes.desc: Article Summary: This paper introduces macro-adoption models for assessing BIM adoption across markets and informing the development of country-specific BIM adoption policies. It clarifies implementation and diffusion terminology and introduces five conceptual constructs for assessing macro-BIM adoption.  The paper covers topics such as BIM readiness, capability, maturity, diffusion models, and policy implications.

nodes.id: A competency knowledge-base for BIM learning.pdf
nodes.label: A competency knowledge-base for BIM learning.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper introduces a conceptual workflow to identify, classify, and aggregate BIM competency items, acting as a knowledge-base for BIM learners and learning providers. It discusses a collaborative BIM education framework and the development of BIM learning modules to satisfy the learning requirements of varied audiences. It also introduces a BIM competency knowledge-base to facilitate a common understanding of BIM deliverables and their requirements.

nodes.id: An integrated approach to BIM competency assessment, acquisition and application.pdf
nodes.label: An integrated approach to BIM competency assessment, acquisition and application.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper discusses an integrated approach to BIM competency, assessment, acquisition, and application. It focuses on individual BIM competencies and proposes taxonomies and models for filtering, classifying, and aggregating these competencies into a seed competency inventory. It also explores the benefits of a competency-based approach to industry and academia and suggests future conceptual and tool development efforts.

nodes.label: Building Information Modelling Maturity Matrix.pdf
nodes.desc: This article introduces a Building Information Modelling (BIM) Maturity Matrix (BIm³) as a performance measurement and improvement tool. It explores the multi-dimensional nature of BIM and assists individuals, organizations, and project teams to assess their BIM capability and maturity. The article covers BIM Fields (Technology, Process, Policy), BIM Stages (object-based modelling, model-based collaboration, network-based integration), BIM Competencies, Organisational Hierarchy/Scale and BIM Maturity Index (BIMMI). It also discusses Capability Maturity Models and the concept of Integrated Project Delivery (IPD).

nodes.label: Model-Uses_Foundations-for-a-Modular-Requirements-Clarification-Language.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper introduces the Model Uses concept, comprising a Model Uses Taxonomy and a Model Uses List. Model Uses are the intended, planned, or expected project deliverables resulting from generating, collaborating, or linking models to external databases. The paper explores the conceptual foundations of Model Uses and then provides practical examples of how this modular language assists in identifying BIM project requirements and facilitating project delivery.

nodes.id: Building Information Modelling- conceptual constructs and performance improvement tools.pdf
nodes.label: Building Information Modelling- conceptual constructs and performance improvement tools.pdf
nodes.desc: Article Summary: A PhD thesis by Bilal Succar exploring conceptual constructs of BIM and tools for performance improvement. It identifies knowledge structures underlying the BIM domain, develops descriptive taxonomies, and presents a BIM framework. It also focuses on developing concepts and tools to facilitate BIM performance assessment and improvement for individuals, organizations, and teams. Key areas include BIM maturity, competency assessment, and knowledge content taxonomies.

nodes.label: Building-Information-Modelling_Point-of-Adoption.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper introduces the Point of Adoption (PoA) model which integrates the concepts of BIM readiness, BIM implementation, and BIM diffusion into a single visual model. The PoA model facilitates the assessment of current organisational abilities, and clarifies a step -wise approach to BIM adoption and continuous performance improvement.

nodes.label: BIM Education, BIM in Practice.pdf
nodes.desc: This document, stemming from the efforts of the BIM Education Working Group, introduces BIM Education, identifies BIM Learning providers, and introduces the BIM Learning Spectrum. It emphasizes the shared responsibility of industry and academia in BIM education and the need to address the requirements of current and future professionals.

nodes.id: Towards a taxonomy of built asset lifecycle information coupling.pdf
nodes.label: Towards a taxonomy of built asset lifecycle information coupling.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper proposes a taxonomy of Built Asset Lifecycle Information Couples which provides the core elements, definitions and characteristics framing the physical-digital coupling of assets and resources in the built asset industry. The taxonomy aims at structuring the knowledge domain of lifecycle information management through the coupling of physical and digital worlds in the built environment. Keywords: Asset Coupling, Taxonomy, Digitalization, Digital Representation, Lifecycle Management.

nodes.id: A proposed approach to comparing the BIM maturity of countries.pdf
nodes.label: A proposed approach to comparing the BIM maturity of countries.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper proposes three metrics to augment survey data and help establish the overall BIM maturity of countries. The metrics assess noteworthy BIM publications (NBPs) and their BIM knowledge content (BKC). The three metrics – NBP availability, NBP content distribution, and NBP relevance - are applied in assessing the knowledge deliverables of three countries – United States, United Kingdom and Australia. The paper then discusses how these complementary metrics can inform policy development and identify market-wide knowledge gaps.

nodes.id: Building Information Modelling Framework- a Research and Delivery Foundation for Industry Stakeholders.pdf
nodes.label: Building Information Modelling Framework- a Research and Delivery Foundation for Industry Stakeholders.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper introduces the BIM Framework, a research and delivery foundation for industry stakeholders. It identifies conceptual parts (fields, stages, steps and lenses), provides examples of their application and lists some of the Framework's deliverables. Visual knowledge models and a specialised ontology are deployed to represent domain concepts and their relations.

nodes.label: Measuring BIM Performance- Five Metrics.pdf
nodes.desc: This article introduces five complementary components for BIM performance assessment: (i) BIM capability stages, (ii) BIM maturity levels, (iii) BIM competencies, (iv) Organizational Scales, and (v) Granularity Levels. It explores these components as a systematic method to understand and improve BIM performance.

nodes.id: Building Information Modeling Analyzing Noteworthy Publications of Eight Countries Using a Knowledge Content Taxonomy.pdf
nodes.label: Building Information Modeling Analyzing Noteworthy Publications of Eight Countries Using a Knowledge Content Taxonomy.pdf
nodes.desc: This article analyzes 57 noteworthy BIM publications from eight countries using a specialized taxonomy to understand the deliverables and knowledge content. The study identifies knowledge gaps and highlights opportunities for future research and complementary publication efforts. It facilitates targeted access to content and provides a knowledge repository for construction stakeholders during BIM implementation.

nodes.id: A Proposed Framework To Investigate Building Information Modelling Through Knowledge Elicitation And Visual Models.pdf
nodes.label: A Proposed Framework To Investigate Building Information Modelling Through Knowledge Elicitation And Visual Models.pdf
nodes.desc: This paper introduces a research framework for identifying BIM concepts and a methodology for capturing and representing BIM interactions. It also proposes visual models to elicit expert knowledge and identifies further research requirements. The framework is composed of three interlocking knowledge nodes: policy, process and technology.
